alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 4:54AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Stormy Pattern Upcoming Late This Week into Early Next Week... A moist Pineapple Express pattern will develop late Friday and persist through early next week, which will come in several waves of moisture from the Pacific. Currently, heavy snow looks to be the main weather impact, although some locations may see brief periods of rain and freezing rain, especially across the Lower Yukon Valley and the Middle Kuskokwim Valley. In addition, expect possible significant blowing and drifting snow as east winds increase ahead of the front late Thursday and persist through late Friday from Norton Sound north to Kotzebue Sound. Residents and interested parties should stay tuned in and monitor the latest forecasts at weather.gov/fairbanks and at our Twitter and Facebook social media accounts for further updates.
